channel.title: Help! Others can't join
channel.description: Here if anyone trying to connect to my server. *How to fix that? -Skype:edvinas720 http://prnt.sc/azwmcb [URL=http://www.part.lt/perziura/1643b0938f13dc5108a2188e54c2833f784.jpg][IMG]http://www.part.lt/img/1643b0938f13dc5108a2188e54c2833f784.jpg[/img][/URL]

item.title: Help! Others can't join
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“williams15, post:7, topic:555323”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=674515.msg4508226#msg4508226 date=1462811285]

first ing i see is your server IP is 0.0.0.0 change that to your public ip

Wrong.

That message is literally:

The server binds to the open port on your computer. Older servers you did have to specify the IP but not newer ones.

my bad… you could have your private ip in the code not public anyway…

Why have an ip in the code when it’s not needed?
[/quote]
wouldnt public IP be needed in the client for others to join…??[/quote]
Yes, in the Client
Not the Server
Which is where the command prompt in the picture is from.

Read full topic

item.title: Help! Others can't join
item.dc:creator: @williams15 williams15
item.description:
@williams15 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:555323”][quote author=williams15 link=topic=674515.msg4508214#msg4508214 date=1462793605]

first ing i see is your server IP is 0.0.0.0 change that to your public ip

Wrong.

That message is literally:

The server binds to the open port on your computer. Older servers you did have to specify the IP but not newer ones.

my bad… you could have your private ip in the code not public anyway…
[/quote]
Why have an ip in the code when it’s not needed?[/quote]
wouldnt public IP be needed in the client for others to join…??

Read full topic
